feels.name: Remorse
feels.quote: Oh, John, my dear, kind, hard-working boy, I didn't mean it! It was so wicked, so untrue and ungrateful, how could I say it! Oh, how could I say it!
feels.exactPlace: In the hall, with her face buried in the old great-coat

feels.name: Despair
feels.quote: The discovery that John had countermanded the order for his new great-coat reduced her to a state of despair which was pathetic to behold.
feels.exactPlace: In the hall, crying as if her heart would break

feels.name: Love
feels.quote: Meg learned to love her husband better for his poverty, because it seemed to have made a man of him, given him the strength and courage to fight his own way, and taught him a tender patience with which to bear and comfort the natural longings and failures of those he loved.
feels.exactPlace: During a long talk that night

feels.name: Hurt
feels.quote: I was afraid of this; I do my best, Meg.

feels.name: Forgiveness
feels.quote: He was very kind, forgave her readily, and did not utter one reproach.

feels.name: Resentment
feels.quote: He had simply said, 'I can't afford it, my dear.'
feels.exactPlace: In the hall, with Meg crying as if her heart would break
